snippet.title: The 50 best restaurants in America
snippet.content:
A great meal at an outstanding restaurant can be a life-changing experience. But with new places popping up every day, it can be difficult to decide which spots are worth your time - and hard-earned cash.
We combined six noteworthy lists compiled by food critics, experts, and diners to come up with a definitive ranking of the best restaurants in the country.
We gave each restaurant a numerical rating based on how many lists the restaurant appeared on and how high it appeared on lists that were ranked. Restaurants that appeared on multiple lists ranked higher on our list, while restaurants that ranked on only one of these lists ended up closer to the bottom. For restaurants that tied, we broke down the rankings based on reviews, price, and our own editorial discretion. .
The lists we used were , , , the , , and the .
Read on to check out the best places to eat across America:
Talia Avakian and Emmie Martin contributed reporting to an earlier version of this article.
Chef: Grant Achatz, Jenner Tomaska (executive chef), Ed Tinoco (chef de cuisine)
Location: Chicago, Illinois
The second Chicago restaurant from Grant Achatz, formats its menus according to a -- like Paris 1906, Childhood, and Chicago Steak House -- and completely changes its offerings every four months.
Similar to tickets to a concert or show, Next sells prepaid reservations to seatings that cost between $US125 and $US165. The current menu is one inspired by classic Hollywood movies.
Chef: Curtis Duffy
Location: Chicago, Illinois
At , Chef Curtis Duffy puts high-quality ingredients front and center, showcasing each one's natural flavours in a variety of contemporary American-style dishes.
The three-Michelin-starred restaurant offers two nine-course tasting menus, called Flora and Fauna, for $US235 per person. They feature selections like Alaskan king crab with cucumber and lemon mint, Australian black truffle with sweet corn and pecorino, and white asparagus with caviar and potatoes.
Go B. / Yelp
Chef: Cesar Ramirez
Location: New York, New York
Sit back and watch as Chef Cesar Ramirez and his team prepare elaborate courses in front of you at , a three-Michelin-starred restaurant.
With an intimate kitchen counter that seats 18, you can indulge in an extravagant tasting menu that focuses on seafood -- including raw fish and shellfish options -- and changes to reflect the freshest ingredients of the season. It lasts two and a half hours and costs $US330 a person.
Brenda P. / Yelp
Chef: Michael Lewis
Location: Miami, Florida
At , Chef Michael Lewis serves up a diverse menu inspired by his travels and Japanese grilling techniques.
Expect 'chilled and refreshing' dishes like a tuna tataki served with fermented chilli and citrus, as well as 'smoked' offerings like a wagyu beef brisket served with black shichimi pepper.
Ann S. / Yelp
Chef: Gilbert Pilgram (executive chef), Rebecca Boice (chef de cuisine)
Location: San Francisco, California
has a seasonal menu that is often rotating, but it's perhaps best known for its roast chicken. Cooked in a wood-fired brick oven for 60 minutes and intended to be eaten by two people, it comes with a warm bread salad of scallions, garlic, mustard greens, dried currants, and pine nuts.
Don't miss the gateau victoire for dessert.
Chef: Suzette Gresham
Location: San Francisco, California
For fine Italian food in the Bay Area, look no further than opulent dining room and delightful prix-fixe menu, which includes three to five courses of plates like Ora King salmon, squid-ink risotto, and hazelnut-crusted venison.
The restaurant has been a standout in San Francisco for more than two decades and now boasts two Michelin stars.
Chef: Donald Link (executive chef), Rebecca Wilcomb (chef de cuisine)
Location: New Orleans, Louisiana
Featuring a menu that blends American and French influences, is one of the most beloved restaurants in New Orleans.
Highlights include a beef short rib starter that comes with potato rosti and salsa verde, as well as a duck confit served with dirty rice and a citrus gastrique for an entree.
Chef: Mike Lata, Jason Stanhope (executive chef)
Location: Charleston, South Carolina
Serving an upscale take on classic Southern dishes, has been a large part of Charleston's growth into a culinary destination.
Expect appetizers like a chicken liver pate with pickles and Dijon, and entrees like a fish stew provencal with shrimp, squid, mussels, and Carolina gold rice.
William Y. / Yelp
Chef: Grant Achatz, Andrew Brochu (executive chef)
Location: Chicago, Illinois
, a more casual and hip option in the Alinea Group, a 'restaurant of the year' by Food & Wine in May.
The menu consists of quirky takes on classic dishes, like a pasta and clam dinner that comes with green chilli and limes rather than an Italian sauce. You should also consider ordering one of the ambitious meat dishes -- ember-roasted ribeye steak, whole chicken and chamomile, or rohan duck -- that are meant to be shared between two to six people.
Chef: Jean Joho
Location: Chicago, Illinois
At , which holds one Michelin star, guests can choose between the seven-course degustation menu, the seven-course vegetarian menu, or three- and four-course prix-fixe menus. Each selection treats guests to elegant French dishes, like magret duck served with marinated turnips, or a filet of sea bass accompanied by potatoes and thyme.
The restaurant, located on the 40th floor of the Chicago Stock Exchange, just celebrated the 30th anniversary of its opening.
Chef: Michael Solomonov
Location: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
-- which translates to 'gold' in Hebrew -- is the highly acclaimed creation of Israeli chef Michael Solomonov, who won the prestigious 'Outstanding Chef' award from the James Beard Foundation for 2017.
The dinner menu is broken down into three categories: salatim and hummus, mezze, and grilled fish, meats, and veggies.
Chef: Mario Batali, Frank Langello (executive chef)
Location: New York, New York
Found on the roster of Mario Batali's many creations, is where you go when you're craving an authentic Italian dish. The focus is on simple but incredibly tasty regional dishes.
The restaurant imports its pasta, specialty cheeses like Parmigiano-Reggiano, and items like balsamic vinegar and prosciutto from Italy, while most of its salumi is prepared in-house.
Annie G. / Yelp
Chef: Aaron Silverman
Location: Washington, DC
For a flat rate of $US280 a person, including tax, tip, and drinks, diners at can enjoy an 11-course tasting menu. On offer are creations like a roasted potato ice cream topped with creme fraiche and Osetra caviar, and a chocolate souffle with a honeycomb ice cream.
You can dine on the same menu at the Chef's Counter and the Bar, the latter of which costs $US180 a person. The restaurant earned two stars in the first Washington, DC edition of the prestigious Michelin Guide in 2016.
Chef: Charlie Palmer, Gabriele Carpentieri (executive chef)
Location: New York, New York
, the flagship restaurant in the Charlie Palmer Group, is located inside the Bank of America Tower off of Bryant Park. At dinner, diners can choose between prix-fixe tasting menus of three and five courses.
Expect dishes like a seared Hudson Valley foie gras -- served with cherry, turnip, and licorice -- and a Moulard duck breast with apricot, chanterelle, and candied shallot.
Chef: Alfred Portale (executive chef), Livio Velardo (chef de cuisine)
Location: New York, New York
For over 30 years, has brought the liveliness of a Paris brasserie to New York's storied Greenwich Village.
The Michelin-starred restaurant makes French food approachable through dishes like miso-marinated black cod with bok choy and roasted heirloom carrots with clementines and feta.
Chef: Michael White, Jared Gadbaw (executive chef), Molly Nickerson (chef de cuisine)
Location: New York, New York
Drawing its name from the Italian word for 'tide,' serves up sophisticated Italian dishes with a strong focus on seafood.
Menu selections at the two-Michelin-starred restaurant include fusilli with red-wine-braised octopus, butter-poached lobster, and a variety of caviars and East Coast oysters.
Owners: Amy Rubenstein, Jody Storch, David Berson (director of operations)
Location: Brooklyn, New York
A beloved Brooklyn institution, has been considered the city's preeminent steakhouse since it was founded in Williamsburg in 1887.
The Forman family has owned the Michelin-starred restaurant since 1950, and they still visit wholesale markets to select cuts of meat, which they age in tightly controlled temperature and humidity conditions in-house.
Chef: Lachlan Mackinnon-Patterson
Location: Boulder, Colorado
Not only does serve exquisite Italian dishes like quail gnocchi, but the restaurant also features an extensive wine list led by Master Sommelier Bobby Stuckey. Only in the world have earned that distinctive title.
Taste a little bit of everything with the chef's tasting menu for $US115, or for a more budget-friendly option, stop by on a Monday for a condensed tasting menu that will set you back just $US55.
Chef: Gary Danko
Location: San Francisco, California
Located in San Francisco's iconic Fisherman's Wharf neighbourhood, has won accolades that range from its three-Michelin-star status to various James Beard awards over the years.
Choose from seafood selections like horseradish-crusted salmon, or meats like juniper-crusted bison with mushroom and onions. You can enjoy three courses for $US87 per person, four courses for $US106 per person, or five courses for $US124 per person.
Chef: Daniel Boulud, Aaron Bludorn (executive chef)
Location: New York, New York
Just blocks from Central Park on New York's Upper East Side, exhibits proprietor Daniel Boulud's culinary inspirations -- seasonal ingredients, vegetables, flavours of world cuisines, and classic French technique -- in a four-part menu.
Dishes range from crispy octopus served with chilli oil and a yogurt sauce to a nine-herb ravioli with ramps, mushrooms, and fava beans.
Chef: Tony Mantuano, Joe Flamm
Location: Chicago, Illinois
Former President Barack Obama the diver scallops at this romantic Italian restaurant one of his favourite things to eat in Chicago.
The Michelin-starred is also notable for its wine program -- it's appeared on Wine Enthusiast's of 'America's 100 Best Wine Restaurants' several times.
Chef: Daniel Humm
Location: New York, New York
At , Chef Daniel Humm and restaurateur Will Guidara -- the talent behind the acclaimed Eleven Madison Park -- blend influences from Switzerland, California, and New York.
Expect exquisite dishes like venison with roasted butternut squash, whole roasted chicken with foie gras and black truffle, or slow-poached eggs with quinoa.
Chef: Daniel Rose
Location: New York, New York
is the creation of the French-educated chef Daniel Rose and famed restaurateur Stephen Starr.
Its interpretation of French classics -- think duck with cherries, foie gras, and black olives, or a a quenelle de brochet with pike and lobster -- has earned the restaurant numerous accolades, including this year's James Beard Award for Best New Restaurant.
Chef: Paul Kahan (executive chef), Ryan Pfeiffer (chef de cuisine)
Location: Chicago, Illinois
Open since 1997, has won its fair share of accolades over the years. It has one Michelin star, and its executive chef, Paul Kahan, won the James Beard Award for Outstanding Chef in 2013.
Diners can either order dishes a la carte or opt for the 10-course tasting menu, which costs $US130 a person, plus a $US70 wine pairing. An aged duck breast served with potato, spring onion, and lavender is among the highlights.
Chef: Gabriel Kreuther
Location: New York, New York
James Beard Award-winning chef brings traditional French techniques from the Alsace region to his eponymous restaurant.
A four-course prix-fixe menu is available for $US142 per guest, featuring dishes like a langoustine tartare with flying fish roe and an Australian lamb rack for two, served with parsley root and a fava bean ragout. You could also upgrade to the chef's carte-blanche menu for $US215 a head.
William Y. / Yelp
Chef: Noah Sandoval
Location: Chicago, Illinois
Two-Michelin-starred restaurant is situated in an unlikely location at the end of an alleyway in Chicago's West Loop neighbourhood.
Diners can work their way through a 15-course, $US190-a-person tasting menu that includes dishes like foie gras with scallop, dried wild blueberry, and oxalis, and a capellini with Australian white truffle, rye berry, and yeast. Executive Chef Noah Sandoval a 'Best New Chef' by Food & Wine in April.
Vicky G. / Yelp
Chef: Aaron Silverman
Location: Washington, DC
Locals line up for hours to dine at , Aaron Silverman's first restaurant in Washington, DC, near Capitol Hill. Barack and Michelle Obama have been known to stop by as well -- the former president even here in 2015.
With standout dishes like a kung pao tofu with Virginia peanuts and broccoli, and a Thai-marinated pork blade steak with Nahm Prik slaw, all meant to be shared, it's clear where the buzz is coming from. Everything ranges from $US13 to $US16, save for a family-style grilled dorade that costs $US37.
Chef: Matthew Kirkley, Justin Mauz (chef de cuisine)
Location: San Francisco, California
Located in San Francisco's North Beach district, the two-Michelin-starred restaurant is all about fresh seafood with a modern twist.
Its nightly menu features the freshest ingredients of the day, with dishes like a loup de mer with honeydew and caviar, at $US250 per person.
Chef: David Chang, Sean Grey (executive chef)
Location: New York, New York
has earned two Michelin stars since 2009. It came in 58th on the list of the World's 50 Best Restaurants.
The prix-fixe tasting menu prepared by Executive Chef Sean Grey includes inventive dishes like a mille-feuille served with green tea powder and trout roe. It costs $US195 per person, while a beverage pairing will set you back an additional $US175.
Mark A. / Yelp
Chef: Jose Andres
Location: Washington, DC
is all about pushing the boundaries of what food should be. Each dish seeks to surprise in its presentation, like 'This is Not Carrot Cake,' a mound of gingerbread with sorbet moulded to look like carrots growing out of it, and another dish that requires using a spoon made out of parmesan.
You can dine either at the six-seat Chef's Counter or the even more private Jose's Table, but it will set you back quite a bit -- prepaid tickets cost $US275 per person for a seat at the counter, while it costs $US565 per person for the table.
Chef: Frank and Pardis Stitt
Location: Birmingham, Alabama
Savoury dishes and impeccable service has made a favourite in Birmingham since it first opened its doors in 1982.
The iconic spot shifts its menu daily to incorporate fresh, seasonal ingredients -- think summers filled with okra soft-shell crab and winters of root vegetables and venison -- that merge French techniques with Southern flavours.
Chef: Rick and Deann Bayless, Andres Padilla (chef de cuisine)
Location: Chicago, Illinois
A Chicago favourite since it opened in 1989, serves contemporary Mexican cuisine divided into three different tasting menus: the five-course 'classic' and 'seasonal options, and a special seven-course offering.
You'll see some interesting twists on Mexican classics, like a taco dish that comes with tongue cooked two ways: crispy braised and black pepper cured.
Chef: Patrick O'Connell
Location: Washington, Virginia
With Chef Patrick O'Connell at the helm, what started as a simple country inn in a former garage in 1978 has grown into a culinary destination.
The two-Michelin-starred serves modern interpretations of dishes from O'Connell's childhood, like a pan-seared Pekin duck breast served with a bundle of Montmorency sour cherries from the inn's orchards. The restaurant serves three tasting menus, each costing $US218 per person plus $US125 for wine pairings, though they do offer the choice to pick and choose courses from among them.
Chef: Masayoshi Takayama
Location: New York, New York
Expect the freshest fish at , where Chef Takayama prepares each meal like a work of art. He keeps the sushi counter sparse of decor in order to create a blank canvas where the food can be the star.
The experience can get pricey, however, costing $US595 per guest. Masa a no-tipping policy last February.
Shell T. / Yelp
Chef: Michael Anthony (executive chef), Howard Kalachnikoff (chef de cuisine)
Location: New York, New York
Restaurateur Danny Meyer opened the contemporary American restaurant in 1994. In the years since, it's earned a Michelin star and spots on many national rankings of notable restaurants.
The focus is on seasonal, rustic ingredients, with entrees that include a cavatelli with pesto, pine nuts, and arrowhead spinach, and a pork belly fried rice with scallions, pepper, and broccoli rabe.
Chef: Christopher Kostow, John Hong (chef de cuisine)
Location: St. Helena, California
focuses on more than just serving great food -- each meal is specifically tailored to the customer. As soon as reservations are made, the chefs begin preparing an individualized menu, developing dishes based on each guest's likes and dislikes.
The standard tasting menu at the three-Michelin-starred restaurant costs $US275 per head, and there's a counter menu available in the kitchen for $US500 per person.
Chef: Abram Bissell
Location: New York, New York
Two-Michelin-starred restaurant is at the Museum of Modern Art. Diners can enjoy a prix-fixe menu in the restaurant's dining room after checking out works by Matisse and Picasso, or select from its a la carte menu in the Bar Room.
Owned by Danny Meyer's Union Square Hospitality Group, the restaurant serves dishes like sauteed foie gras and grilled lobster with ginger-braised fennel and caramelised nectarine.
Chef: Jean-Georges Vongerichten, Mark Lapico (executive chef)
Location: New York, New York
blends French, American, and Asian influences to craft an ever-changing menu that focuses on ingredients from the local farmer's market.
Inside, floor-to-ceiling windows offer stunning views of Central Park and Columbus Circle, and diners can choose between various prix-fixe menus that range from $US138 to $US238 per person.
Chef: David Kinch
Location: Los Gatos, California
At three-Michelin-starred , the menu changes daily to incorporate the freshest ingredients from local farms.
Dishes for the tasting menu have included everything from black cod served with Brussels sprouts in a vinegar reduction, to a pumpkin puree with chocolate cremeux. The tasting menu costs $US255 per person, with an additional $US198 for a wine pairing.
Chef: Corey Lee, Brandon Rodgers (executive chef)
Location: San Francisco, California
The three-Michelin-starred restaurant offers diners an innovative mix of American and Asian cuisine.
Its $US285-per-person tasting menu has included eclectic dishes like its thousand-year-old quail egg served with potage and ginger, and a fried river eel with lily bulb, pepper leaf, and rose wine. Finish it off with the acorn and chocolate dish for an unforgettable meal.
Chef: Thomas Keller, David Breeden (chef de cuisine)
Location: Yountville, California
For $US310 a head, diners at choose between two prix-fixe menus -- the chef's tasting menu or the vegetable-tasting menu -- which change daily and don't repeat a single ingredient throughout.
The multicourse menus include everything from caramelised summer squash to slow-cooked steelhead trout to charcoal-grilled Japanese Wagyu.
Chef: Enrique Olvera, Daniela Soto-Innes (chef de cuisine)
Location: New York, New York
provides an avant-garde take on Mexican food staples. There's an $US89 duck carnitas dish that takes nearly four days to prepare, a mixture of sauteed onions, garlic, tomatoes, ancho chilli peppers, orange, condensed and evaporated milks, and even Mexican coke.
The restaurant from Mexico City native Enrique Olvera cracked the for the first time this year, coming in at 40th.
Chef: Daniel Boulud, Jean-Francois Bruel (executive chef), Eddy Leroux (chef de cuisine)
Location: New York, New York
At Daniel Boulud's namesake restaurant, , which boasts two Michelin stars, the chefs draw inspiration from the four seasons, which it translates into upscale French cuisine.
A sampling of dishes might include Long Island fluke with sea urchin and green apple, roasted duck breast topped with a dandelion-flower marmalade, or ravioli filled with braised rabbit and covered in chorizo cream.
Chef: Josh Skenes
Location: San Francisco, California
offers a playful and inventive tasting menu, with the dishes changing nightly based on the local ingredients and what's available from their own garden.
Some sample courses from Chef Joshua Skenes' three-Michelin-starred menu have included foie-gras toffee, oyster leaf with cream, and thin slices of beef aged for 80 days and complemented with soy vinaigrette. The 15- to 20-course tasting menu costs $US398 per person.
Chef: Thomas Keller, Eli Kaimeh (chef de cuisine)
Location: New York, New York
lives under the Keller umbrella of restaurants, and chef de cuisine Eli Kaimeh whips up top-notch French cuisine, earning the spot three Michelin stars.
The vegetable and chef's tasting menus are $US325, and they're each nine courses that don't repeat a single ingredient throughout.
Chef: Michael Tusk
Location: San Francisco, California
At the three-Michelin-starred restaurant , diners are treated to a $US210, nine-course tasting menu featuring the season's top produce. Diners can also opt for an expanded version of the tasting menu for $US250 a person. Examples include milk-fed lamb served with fava beans and olive, or Monterey Bay abalone with green tomato and brown butter.
With a scenery that is elegant without being stuffy, and the option to order a la carte from the restaurant's salon, you can enjoy a high-quality meal without all the formalities.
Chef: Dan Barber, Nick Hukezalie
Location: Pocantico Hills, New York
Seated on a working four-season farm, sources all of its ingredients from the surrounding land or other local farms, aiming to highlight the many flavours of its home in the Hudson Valley.
The farm-to-table spot offers no a la carte options, only the 'Grazing, Pecking, Rooting' tasting menu for $US258 a head, which highlights fresh, seasonal ingredients.
Chef: Eric Ripert, Eric Gestel (executive chef)
Location: New York, New York
A New York City classic since 1986, three-Michelin-starred uses French techniques to create exquisitely prepared seafood dishes.
Try the chef's tasting menu for $US220 per person, or the Le Bernardin-branded tasting menu for $US180 a pop, which include delicacies like seared langoustine foie gras and a crusted red snapper in a white balsamic-anticucho sauce.
Chef: Daniel Humm, Dmitri Magi (chef de cuisine)
Location: New York, New York
continues to impress, earning three Michelin stars and the top spot on the World's 50 Best Restaurants list this year.
The restaurant, currently closed for renovations, offers only an elaborate prix-fixe menu that goes for $US295 per person. Each meal is based on ingredients sourced locally in New York.
Chef: Grant Achatz, Mike Bagale (executive chef), and Simon Davies (chef de cuisine)
Location: Chicago, Illinois
is a three-Michelin-starred restaurant with avant-garde dishes that showcase the molecular gastronomy skills of Chefs Grant Achatz, Mike Bagale, and Simon Davies.
Diners are constantly surprised by the delicious creations, from a DIY ravioli course to a hot potato that's been topped with a slice of black truffle and suspended above cold potato soup.
NOW WATCH: Money & Markets videos
Business Insider Emails & Alerts
Site highlights each day to your inbox.

sindex.name: Danny Meyer's Union Square Hospitality Group
